page.title: 17MILK PRODUCTION IN SOMERSET
page.content: VISITORS TO SOMERSET THINK ABOUT,OR ASK ABOUT CREAM OR CHEESE.AS THEY PASS THROUGH THE COUNTRYSIDE THE FIELDS ARE MOSTLY MEODOWLAND,AT LEAST THAT IS TRUE OF THIS AREA. THE OLD COARSE PERMAMENT PASTURE HAS BEEN REPLACED BY THE LUSH GREEN OF SOWN GRASSLAND.IN SUMMER,THE MAIN VARIATION IS BETWEEN GRAZING LAND AND MOWN HAY. THE MAJORITY OF THE CATTLE ARE THE BLACK AND WHITE FREISIONS.THESE ARE SEEN FEEDING CONTENDIDLY IN THE FIELDS OR AMBLING ALONG THE COUNTRY ROADS,HOLDING UP TRAFFIC,ASTHEY ARE TAKEN FOR MILKING. ALONG THE SAME ROADS,TRAVEL THE BLUE M.M.B LORRIES TO COLLECT THE MILK AND TRANSPORT IT TO THE LOCAL DAIRY FOR PROCESSING. MILK FROM THE COW IS SELDOM DRUNK UNLESS YOU LIVE ON A FARM.
